page.title: 04ECOLOGY - CHALLENGE OF TODAY
page.content: Ecology has an influence on the area weatherwise. At the time of writing we have just suffered a disastrous summer following a cold wet spring. This is a very windy region maybe because the terrain tends to be flat and open. The soil varies, parts are loam and fairly light in contrast to belts of heavy clay. There are two deciduous woods and some small spinneys dotted over the landscape.Hulcote and Winter Wood are two areas of confined woodland and Winter Wood.The only footpath known to be in general use at present, leads off Broughton Road just past the old Smithy across land owned by College Farm up to Salford Wood. Birds native to this country and migrants such as the swallow and cuckoo are plentiful.Wild life is well represented by rabbits, small animals, insects and reptiles.
